name: E K
text:
We finally visited here for a weekday lunch. We've always wanted to come here, wondering when we'll find the time to actually do so, and it was only after we suddenly received an advisement from the restaurant that we finally decided to check it out.

Our meal consisted of an arugula salad, a 12 inch white pizza, and a free 12 inch Carnivori thanks to the coupon.

Their pizzas were phenomenal! The Carnivori was so generous with its toppings you really get to feel like a meat lover while eating it. The sausages and meatballs were so flavorful and I really liked the thin cut pepperoni.

The White Pizza was a cheese tour de force! The combination of Ricotta, Mozzarella, and Romano cheese was great, it had a wonderful aroma, and of course it was so scrumptious. One bite gives you a gooey  warm rich happiness in your mouth.

We really liked the salad with Burrata as well. The cheese was very rich, and it paired well with the vinegary dressing. The salad comes with Focaccia bread, and it was also very tasty.

Our server Luis was very pleasant. He recommended us their popular dishes while we are deciding what to order, and he was very attentive.

We're looking forward to coming back here again soon.

name: Richard J. Perez
text:
Again, a location problem.

Anthony's CFP has been a favorite of our family for years. But there's always a problem with the Doral location. This is the 'take-out' location of choice for us. Well, 4 out 10 times they get it wrong. This is no exaggeration but a real statistic. It became a running joke with the girls at the bar who would graciously apologize. This time I order 3 Anthony's Special Sandwich (a Mozzarella sandwich), just to get home and find 3 sandwiches with NO Mozzarella to be found in them, basically an arugula and tomato sandwich. I call back, they apologize, the call the manager, he's busy, give me your number, he'll call you, you'll be credited the whole amount... NOTHING happened. A month later i go back (what was I thinking), and after placing my order i very casually mention the last incident, and the guy next to the register (happens to be the manager), jumps at me saying he did call and solved the problem. I stop him and offer my cell so he can check if there's any call from ACFP; furthermore, where's the credit to my CC? He starts arguing back. I told him, look, you have given me prosciutto pizzas without prosciutto, cheese sandwiches without cheese, and I still come back because of your amazing crew, but let's call it a night. I paid (he didn't even hint at a courtesy credit, not even the beer I had while waiting), left them my usual fat tip, and left. Never again. Nothing can save a store from a Terrible Manager, Mr. Munoz.
